item.title: The Role
item.description:
Nurse Immunisers

Horsham, Australia

Reference: 6807311

Casual Engagement (open-ended application arrangements)

An opportunity for suitably qualified individuals to join the HRCC immunisation team is available.

Nurse immunisers play a crucial role in protecting our community, by delivering the National Immunisation Program.

The successful applicants will be Registered Nurses with a Nurse Immuniser qualification. Ability to work off site and a Working with Children Check is required.

For a confidential conversation, please contact Coordinator Youth & Early Yers, Louise Kelly on 5382 9522

For more information, please see attached Position Description.

Applications will be received on an open-ended basis and interviews may proceed at any time.

Applications Close: 31 Dec 2025

Current vacancies

    Swim Instructor

    Apply now Job no: 493202
    Work type: Casual
    Location: Melbourne
    Categories: Leisure Services

    Swim Instructors 

    Mitchell Shire Council has embarked on Victoria’s last great story of growth.

    Located just 40 minutes from Melbourne where the city meets the country, we’re renowned for our scenic beauty that’s rich in both history and heritage.  We’re home to a mix of beautiful natural landscapes, townships and emerging communities in some of Australia’s fastest-growing suburbs.

    Come join a Local Government Organisation offering a fantastic opportunity for Community, Opportunity and Growth for the right applicant.

    This is your opportunity to join a supportive organisation in an area with rapid population growth. In 2025 Mitchell Shire is home to 64,175 residents, it is forecast to grow to 221,636 by 2046.

    About the Role

    A typical day in the role includes educating a range of age groups on water safety by the development of fun and engagement programs, supporting the provision of a safe environment for patrons, ensuring that the Aquatic Facilities operates in a clean, hygienic and safe manner in accordance with health regulations and public safety requirements. Our Leisure Centres operate seven (7) days a week with outdoor pools running through the Summer Season.

    This is a casual opportunity with the hourly rate beginning at $42.57 (LSO Band 3) plus superannuation. Positions are available at both Seymour and Kilmore Leisure Centres.

    About you

    You will be energetic, passionate and fun. You work well within a team, have outstanding communication skills and enjoy dealing with the public. You take initiative and are professional in your approach. You will possess a current level 2 first aid (HLTAID003, current Employee Working with Children Check and current AUSTSWIM or similar accreditation.

    If you are passionate about providing exceptional customer service and value water safety, this is a great oppo

Current vacancies

    Manager Community Activation

    Apply now Job no: 493459
    Work type: Permanent
    Location: Melbourne
    Categories: Community Services and Development, Customer and Library Services Service, Leisure Services

    Manager, Community Activation

    Turn ideas into activity. Put people and places at the centre.

    Mitchell Shire is entering a defining chapter.

    40km north of Melbourne, our Shire spans Beveridge, Wallan, Kilmore, Broadford and Seymour. We’re a key growth corridor — balancing rapid residential expansion with the country character and community values that make Mitchell, Mitchell. With strong growth ahead, every one of our 40+ townships has a role to play.

    We’re setting the organisation up for what’s next.

    A refreshed structure, clearer accountability, and faster decisions. This role — Manager, Community Activation — brings together Libraries, Leisure, and Community Development to deliver coordinated programs, partnerships, and facilities that strengthen wellbeing, participation, inclusion, and connectedness — in the heart of Victoria.

    About the role

    The Manager, Community Activation provides strategic and operational leadership across Libraries, Leisure, and Community Development. Reporting to the Director, Partnerships, Economy and Communities and working with the Senior Management Team, you’ll lead teams to deliver high-quality, accessible and innovative services — creating opportunities for lifelong learning, active lifestyles, cultural enrichment and stronger community capacity.

    Your focus is simple: make it easier for people to participate, belong, and lead — in their street, their township and across the Shire.

    You’ll deliver:

    • Clear direction and plans for Libraries, Leisure, and Community Development — annual business plans, service standards and a program of continuous improvement aligned to community priorities.
    • High-quality programs, events,

    General Counsel

    Apply now Job no: 493460
    Work type: Permanent
    Location: Melbourne
    Categories: Compliance

    General Counsel

    Build a practical in-house legal function for our future

    Mitchell Shire is entering a defining chapter.

    40km north of Melbourne, our Shire spans Beveridge, Wallan, Kilmore, Broadford and Seymour. We’re a key growth corridor — balancing rapid residential expansion with the country character and community values that make Mitchell, Mitchell. With more than 64,000 residents today and strong growth ahead, every one of our 40+ townships has a role to play.

    We’re setting the organisation up for what’s next.

    A new structure, four new senior leadership roles, clearer accountability and faster decisions. This position — our first in-house General Counsel — brings Legal and Property together to enable timely, well-reasoned decisions, reduce external spend and protect public value. It’s strategic when required and hands-on when it counts.

    About the role

    The General Counsel is Council’s principal legal adviser.

    Reporting to the Director, Organisational Performance and working with the Senior Management Team, you’ll establish a contemporary, service-oriented legal function, lead the Property team and turn complexity into clear, actionable solutions.  

    Focus areas include property transactions, commercial agreements, procurement and probity, governance and administrative decision-making - supported by the systems and templates that help teams deliver at pace.

    Your focus is simple: help the organisation make good decisions, quickly and confidently.

    You’ll deliver:

    • Clear, plain-language advice across property, contracts, procurement, planning, governance and administrative law.
    • Drafting and negotiation of leases, licences, deeds and commercial agreements aligned to Council’s risk profile and obligations.
    • Practical te

    Work type: Permanent

    Senior Business Support Administration Officer

    Mitchell Shire Council has embarked on Victoria’s last great story of growth.

    Located just 40 minutes from Melbourne where the city meets the country, we’re renowned for our scenic beauty that’s rich in both history and heritage.  We’re home to a mix of beautiful natural landscapes, townships and emerging communities in some of Australia’s fastest-growing suburbs.

    Join a Local Government organisation committed to fostering Community, Opportunity, and Growth — for both our people and the communities we serve

    This is your opportunity to join a supportive organisation in an area with rapid population growth. In 2025 Mitchell Shire is home to 64,175 residents, it is forecast to grow to 221,636 by 2046.

    About the Opportunity

    In this pivotal position, you will lead a centralised business management function within the Operations and Assets Department. Your leadership and organisational expertise will help ensure smooth administrative processes, efficient resource management, and continuous improvement across multiple service areas.

    You’ll work closely with Coordinators, team leaders and staff to align business support with organisational priorities—fostering a culture of professionalism, accountability, and teamwork.

    This role is a permanent full time opportunity with a Monthly ADO. Remuneration begins at $76K to $87K (Band 5) plus superannuation.

    About You

    The person we are looking for is a confident, capable leader with proven experience in business or administrative management, ideally within a local government or operations setting. Skilled in communication, process improvement, and team leadership, you excel at managing priorities, driving efficiency, and leveraging business systems to achieve results.

item.title: Current vacancies
item.salary: Band 8) plus superannuation. About You You’re a curious problem-solver with a knack for simplifying complexity. You know your way around TechnologyOne (Ci & Ci Anywhere) and can balance the big-picture strategy with hands-on technical detail. You’re just as comfortable deep-diving into SQL and workflows as you are explaining a solution to a non-technical stakeholder. You’ll bring: Around 10+ years of hands-on TechnologyOne configuration or consulting experience , ideally within mid-to-large, complex organisations. Deep knowledge of TechnologyOne’s core features — from user access, permissions and security categories, to ETL, stored procedures, BPAs, data models and analytics. Solid SQL and programming skills to create stored scripts, advanced queries, and data extracts that make systems talk to each other beautifully. A strong grasp of the solution design and development lifecycle — you know your way from requirements gathering and scoping through to configuration, testing, and change management. Proven project management experience , successfully delivering enterprise-level improvements and system changes. The ability to clearly document and communicate changes, ensuring transparency and continuity across teams. You’re collaborative, detail-oriented, and not afraid to roll up your sleeves to make tech work better for people. For further information about this role please contact Christine Beaton, ERP Transformation Coordinator on 03 5734 6414. All applications must address the Key Selection Criteria in the position description. For information on how to apply, please visit our Careers page . Mitchell Shire Council is a Child Safe Organisation. The successful applicant will be required to obtain a Working with Children Check, prior to commencement. Mitchell Shire Council is an equal opportunity employer and committed to building a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace. Applications close at 5pm Monday 3 November 2025. Use your deep technical expertise in ERP architecture, SQL development, systems integration, and data analytics to deliver innovative, enterprise-level solutions that enhance performance, security, business outcomes, and customer experience across Mitchell! Current opportunities Position Location Closes ERP Solutions Architect Melbourne 3 Nov 2025 Lead the strategic design, configuration, and optimisation of Council’s TechnologyOne enterprise resource planning platform.     Work type: Permanent
    Location: Melbourne

    Mitchell Shire Council has embarked on Victoria’s last great story of growth.

    About the Opportunity

    • Drive the vision: Lead the strategic development of our TechnologyOne ERP platform to deliver real benefits for staff, the community, and the organisation.

    • Design smart solutions: Translate business needs into practical, scalable solution designs and blueprints.

    • Deliver projects that matter: Manage and deliver enterprise-level ERP improvement projects — from scoping to go-live.

    • Collaborate and connect: Partner with business units and the Transformation team to align technology solutions with organisational goals.

    • Get hands-on: Perform advanced configuration across modules like CES, Finance, Property & Rating, HR/Payroll and ECM, and build integrations within our broader corporate ecosystem.

    • Make data work for everyone: Develop data models, dashboards, and reports to enhance data-driven decision making.

    • Lead and share knowledge: Provide technical guidance, develop proof-of-co

    This role is a permanent, part-time opportunity (FTE 0.60 - 45.60 hours per fortnight). Remuneration begins at $91.6K to $99.6K (Band 6) pro rata plus superannuation.

The role will be responsible for ensuring the timely and efficient delivery of debt recovery processes across Council's revenue streams - from rates and charges to sundry debts. You'll engage directly with residents, businesses, and internal stakeholders to resolve outstanding accounts respectfully and effectively.

    This role is a permanent, part-time (0.6 FTE, 45.60 hours per fortnight) opportunity. Remuneration begins at $76.4K to $87.1K (Band 5) pro-rata for part time, plus superannuation.

Current vacancies

    Stadium Activation Officer

    Apply now Job no: 493468
    Work type: Permanent
    Location: Melbourne
    Categories: Leisure Services

    Stadium Activation Officer

    Mitchell Shire Council has embarked on Victoria’s last great story of growth.

    Located just 40 minutes from Melbourne where the city meets the country, we’re renowned for our scenic beauty that’s rich in both history and heritage. We’re home to a mix of beautiful natural landscapes, townships and emerging communities in some of Australia’s fastest-growing suburbs.

    Come join a Local Government Organisation offering a fantastic opportunity for Community, Opportunity and Growth for the right applicant.

    This is your opportunity to join a supportive organisation in an area with rapid population growth. In 2025 Mitchell Shire is home to 64,175 residents; it is forecast to grow to 221,636 by 2046.

    About the Opportunity

    Help us turn two under-utilised stadiums into buzzing community hubs. On a typical day you’ll:

    • Lead smooth stadium operations at Seymour Sports & Aquatic Centre Stadium and Broadford Leisure Centre Stadium (presentation, cleaning, kiosk, customer service and OHS).

    • Coordinate casual rosters for peak times and events, and manage bookings, allocations and invoicing in line with Council’s User Fees and Charges.

    • Build programs for all ages and abilities across multiple indoor sports, partnering with peak sporting bodies to bring clinics, comps and coach/official development to Mitchell.

    • Engage clubs and schools, support governance and scheduling, and help activate regular after-school opening at Broadford for casual shooting, youth engagement and future health and fitness options.

    Hours: While not currently set hours, a large proportion of this role will be after-school, direct service hours at the Broadford Leisure Centre (Stadium) to support site opening. You may also n

Current vacancies

    Open Space Planner

    Apply now Job no: 493469
    Work type: Permanent
    Location: Melbourne
    Categories: Community Services and Development, Planning

    Open Space Planner

    Mitchell Shire Council has embarked on Victoria’s last great story of growth.

    Located just 40 minutes from Melbourne where the city meets the country, we’re renowned for our scenic beauty that’s rich in both history and heritage.  We’re home to a mix of beautiful natural landscapes, townships and emerging communities in some of Australia’s fastest-growing suburbs.

    Come join a Local Government Organisation offering a fantastic opportunity for Community, Opportunity and Growth for the right applicant.

    This is your opportunity to join a supportive organisation in an area with rapid population growth. In 2025 Mitchell Shire is home to 64,175 residents, it is forecast to grow to 221,636 by 2046.

    About the Opportunity

    The Open Space Planner role will lead the development and implementation of policies, strategies, and plans that guide the delivery of open space services across the municipality, including the finalisation and implementation of the Mitchell Open Space Strategy.
     
    This position will ensure that the planning and provision of open space meet the needs of Mitchell’s current and future communities, supporting sustainable growth and enhancing the overall liveability of the region.
     
    The role will also be responsible for building and maintaining strong, effective partnerships with key stakeholders, including internal departments, government agencies, and community organisations. Through these collaborations, the Open Space Planner will facilitate the achievement of Council’s strategic goals and priorities, working to improve recreation and open space outcomes and contribute to the health and wellbeing of Mitchell’s communities.

    This role is a permanent opportunity with a Monthly ADO. Remuneration begins at $102.7K to $114.7K (Band 7) plus superannuat

item.title: Child and Family Support Assistant
item.salary: Band 4 salary from $78,402.48 per annum plus superannuation and a fortnightly RDO Location: Werribee based with potential for a hybrid work arrangement About the role This is an exciting time to be a part of Wyndham’s early years services! With over 100 babies born every week in the municipality and over 6,000 registrations received yearly via our kindergarten central registration system, Wyndham is a growing community that looks for open-minded, passionate, and community-focused people to respond to their needs. In the Child & Family Support Team, you are integral to the success of the Community Support Department by delivering high-quality customer service and administration skills to facilitate access to Maternal & Child Health services and the kindergarten Central Registration Scheme for the community. This rewarding role will require you to be able to address the needs of our community in an efficient and effective manner, maintaining compliance with our regulatory and operational requirements and procedures. Never a dull moment in this role, you will thrive with your attention to detail, positive stakeholder collaboration, and exceptional customer service skills. We are seeking Child & Family Support Assistants to join our team supporting the delivery of Maternal & Child Health services in a temporary capacity or the kindergarten Central Registration Scheme in a permanent capacity, ensuring that Wyndham is meeting the growing demand for these services. Within the Maternal & Child Health stream, your day-to-day will see you processing notifications of new births in Wyndham, responding to nurse requests, maintaining the appointment calendars, and, crucially, supporting customer access to the service. Previous experience in MCH, health, early years services, or a similar, highly-regulated environment is desirable. Within the kindergarten central registration stream, your day-to-day will involve administering the Central Registration Scheme. You will be responsible for processing registration applications into the central registration system, empowering families to navigate and access kindergarten services, and responding to a variety of complex customer queries. Previous experience in early years services or central registration is desirable. What your day will look like Providing friendly, professional, and helpful assistance to community members, supporting them to access early years and family services that meet their needs. Delivering accurate and efficient administrative support to the Community Support Department, contributing to the smooth operation of all children and family services. Processing registrations, bookings, and birth notifications in line with council policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements. Liaising with internal teams and external partners about registrations, referrals, bookings, and system updates to ensure accurate information sharing and service delivery. Maintaining accurate records, data entry, and statistical reporting using council databases and reporting systems. Supporting continuous improvement by assisting with general administrative tasks and other duties aligned with your skills, abilities, and the needs of the team. What you will bring Demonstrated ability to work within a team environment collaboratively and respectfully, striving towards Council’s values, policies, and procedures Strong administrative experience, with proficiency in a range of computer systems and the ability to learn other software programs High-level customer service and problem-resolution skills to support community and stakeholders in a dynamic, fast-paced environment The ability to organise and control one's own workload and time to achieve specified outputs Certificate in administration or relevant administration experience Current Working with Children Check or willingness to obtain one If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role via the provided link. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday, 2 November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Kaycee Shapter, Team Leader Child & Family Support on 9394 6885. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. Child Safe Organisation Wyndham City Council has zero tolerance to any form of child abuse and is committed to the safety, wellbeing and empowerment of children. We create and maintain a child safe organisation which is embedded in the everyday thinking and practice of all employees, volunteers and contractors. Additionally, we are committed to fostering a culture of safety within the Council, which includes the inclusion and empowerment of Aboriginal children, their families, and communities. Our recruitment practices reflect this. Diversity and Inclusion At Wyndham City Council we value workforce diversity and inclusion and embrace individual uniqueness. We value diverse life experiences and the perspectives of our people, while providing high-quality services to all members of our community, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, cultural background, disability, or sexuality. Wyndham has one of the largest Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities in the Western Region, with a rich and diverse history. We are committed to providing positive employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and welcome applications from candidates of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background. To read more about Wyndham City’s Innovate Reconciliation Action Plan, please visit our website . Additional Information Employee Status: Permanent Schedule: Full-time Position Description: PD Current - City Life - Community Support - Child and Family Support Assistant - Various x 22 - Band 4 Previous Searches My Profile Create and manage profiles for future opportunities. item.title: Casual Child and Family Support Assistants
item.salary: Hourly rate $49.59 plus superannuation Location: Werribee based with potential for a hybrid work arrangement About the role This is an exciting time to be a part of Wyndham’s early years services! With over 100 babies born every week in the municipality, Wyndham is a growing community that looks for open-minded, passionate, and community-focused people to respond to their needs. In the Child & Family Support Team, you are integral to the success of the Community Support Department by delivering high-quality customer service and administration skills to facilitate access to Maternal & Child Health services for the community. This rewarding role will require you to be able to address the needs of our community in an efficient and effective manner, maintaining compliance with our regulatory and operational requirements and procedures. Never a dull moment in this role, you will thrive with your attention to detail, positive stakeholder collaboration, and exceptional customer service skills. We are seeking Child & Family Support Assistants to join our team in a casual capacity. In our casual pool, you will generally be notified in-advance of any rostered days. The rosters are developed in consideration of leave, workload, and known service demand peaks, and your Team Leader will remain in regular communication to understand how your availability aligns. Within the team, your day-to-day will see you processing notifications of new births in Wyndham, responding to nurse requests, maintaining the appointment calendars, and, crucially, supporting customer access to the service. Previous experience in MCH, health, early years services, or a similar, highly-regulated environment is desirable. To get the most out of your training and engagement, we are seeking applicants who are regularly available for 3 days per week, noting that we understand that this may not always be possible. What your day will look like Providing friendly, professional, and helpful assistance to community members, supporting them to access early years and family services that meet their needs. Delivering accurate and efficient administrative support to the Community Support Department, contributing to the smooth operation of all children and family services. Processing birth notifications and appointment bookings in line with council policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements. Maintaining accurate records, data entry, and statistical reporting using council databases and reporting systems. Supporting continuous improvement by assisting with general administrative tasks and other duties aligned with your skills, abilities, and the needs of the team. What you will bring Demonstrated ability to work within a team environment collaboratively and respectfully, striving towards Council’s values, policies, and procedures Strong administrative experience, with proficiency in a range of computer systems and the ability to learn other software programs High-level customer service and problem-resolution skills to support community and stakeholders in a dynamic, fast-paced environment The ability to organise and control one's own workload and time to achieve specified outputs Availability to work on an ‘as needed’ basis Certificate in administration or relevant administration experience Current Working with Children Check or willingness to obtain one If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role via the provided link. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday, 2 November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Kaycee Shapter, Team Leader Child & Family Support on 9394 6885. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. Child Safe Organisation Wyndham City Council has zero tolerance to any form of child abuse and is committed to the safety, wellbeing and empowerment of children. We create and maintain a child safe organisation which is embedded in the everyday thinking and practice of all employees, volunteers and contractors. Additionally, we are committed to fostering a culture of safety within the Council, which includes the inclusion and empowerment of Aboriginal children, their families, and communities. Our recruitment practices reflect this. Diversity and Inclusion At Wyndham City Council we value workforce diversity and inclusion and embrace individual uniqueness. We value diverse life experiences and the perspectives of our people, while providing high-quality services to all members of our community, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, cultural background, disability, or sexuality. Wyndham has one of the largest Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities in the Western Region, with a rich and diverse history. We are committed to providing positive employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and welcome applications from candidates of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background. To read more about Wyndham City’s Innovate Reconciliation Action Plan, please visit our website . Remuneration: Hourly rate $49.59 plus superannuation

Location: Werribee based with potential for a hybrid work arrangement

About the role

This is an exciting time to be a part of Wyndham’s early years services! With over 100 babies born every week in the municipality, Wyndham is a growing community that looks for open-minded, passionate, and community-focused people to respond to their needs.

In the Child & Family Support Team, you are integral to the success of the Community Support Department by delivering high-quality customer service and administration skills to facilitate access to Maternal & Child Health services for the community.

item.title: Area Leader Capital Delivery
item.salary: Band 8 salary from $132,607.76 per annum plus superannuation and a fortnightly RDO Location: Werribee based About the role We have two key opportunities, reporting to the Coordinator Construction and Development Services, for an Area Leader (Brownfields) and Area Leader (Greenfields). These roles are responsible for leading the operational delivery of Council’s capital works program, with a strong emphasis on building projects across both established (Brownfields) and growth (Greenfields) areas. Each Area Leader will provide strategic and day-to-day leadership, coordination, and professional support to a team of Senior Project Managers and Project Managers, ensuring the successful planning, design, procurement, and delivery of high-quality community infrastructure. You will ensure infrastructure and facilities projects are delivered on time, on budget, and to the highest quality and compliance standards while fostering a high-performance, collaborative team culture. This role also supports resource management, program-level oversight, risk management, financial accountability, and long-term infrastructure investment planning. Working within the Construction and Development Services Unit in the Facilities, Fleet & Depot Stores Department of the City Operations Directorate, you will be instrumental in driving continuous improvement in project management capability, stakeholder engagement, and service delivery for the community. This position may require occasional weekend, public holiday, and after-hours work, as well as travel across the municipality. What your day will look like · Lead, mentor, and supervise Senior Project Managers and Project Managers to ensure effective delivery of capital works projects · Oversee operational leadership across capital works programs, including project milestones, resource planning, and reporting · Ensure compliance with codes, scope, budget, time, and quality standards, escalating issues where necessary · Manage financial activities including budget preparation, forecasting, and cost control · Oversee preparation and quality control of project documentation from design to delivery including contracts, tenders, and contractor performance reports · Promote strong stakeholder engagement and communication to minimise disruptions and maximise community benefit · Drive continuous improvement in project management systems, processes, and governance What you will bring · Tertiary qualification in Project Management, Civil/Structural Engineering, Construction Management, Architecture, or a related discipline · Extensive experience delivering complex infrastructure projects, with a focus on facilities greenfield or brownfield delivery, in a public sector, consulting, or construction environment · Proven leadership skills in managing and developing multidisciplinary project teams · Strong financial, contract administration, risk management, and WHS compliance knowledge · High-level proficiency in project management systems · Excellent stakeholder engagement, negotiation, and communication skills · Understanding of long-term asset planning and infrastructure investment strategies · Current Victorian Driver’s Licence, Construction Induction (White) Card, and Working with Children Check If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role via the provided link. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday, 9 November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Amol Khapre, Coordinator Construction & Development Services on 9394 6881. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. Child Safe Organisation Wyndham City Council has zero tolerance to any form of child abuse and is committed to the safety, wellbeing and empowerment of children. We create and maintain a child safe organisation which is embedded in the everyday thinking and practice of all employees, volunteers and contractors. Additionally, we are committed to fostering a culture of safety within the Council, which includes the inclusion and empowerment of Aboriginal children, their families, and communities. Our recruitment practices reflect this. Diversity and Inclusion At Wyndham City Council we value workforce diversity and inclusion and embrace individual uniqueness. We value diverse life experiences and the perspectives of our people, while providing high-quality services to all members of our community, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, cultural background, disability, or sexuality. Wyndham has one of the largest Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities in the Western Region, with a rich and diverse history. We are committed to providing positive employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and welcome applications from candidates of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background. To read more about Wyndham City’s Innovate Reconciliation Action Plan, please visit our website . item.title: Senior Fleet Officer
item.salary: Band 6 salary from $104,133.36 per annum plus superannuation and a fortnightly RDO Location: Werribee and Hoppers Crossing based About the role As a Senior Fleet Officer, you will partner with Team Leader Fleet Management to deliver a fully integrated approach to fleet procurement, lifecycle maintenance, and policy compliance. You will make this role your own driving the specialist data, systems, and procurement functions that keep Council’s fleet safe, cost-efficient, and compliant to audits while looking for improvements along the way. What your day will look like · Managing the yearly Fleet Procurement Plan, including light vehicles, trucks, specialised fleet items and plant, using proven assessment methods of assets due for changeover and make recommendations on appropriate replacements · Developing vehicle and plant specifications with relevant stakeholders ensuring alignment with operational needs and Council policy · Leading the procurement process including preparation of Tender and RFQ documentation · Maintaining the accuracy of Fleet data in Council’s long-term financial place and asset plan, and assets plan · Administering the roadside assistance programs, fuel cards, registration renewal and toll invoice processing · Administering Council’s GPS platform, including data accuracy user access and vendor liaison · Overseeing the pool-vehicle booking system, ensuring availability, utilisation reporting and user support · Analysing fleet lifecycle cost, utilisation, and data, and support implementation of data-informed approaches to optimise Fleet What you will bring · Degree or diploma in a relevant field with relevant experience OR a lesser qualification with substantial relevant experience in procurement · Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills both verbal and written, with the ability to deal with a diverse range of stakeholders · Well-developed time management and organisational skills with the ability to work autonomously · Demonstrated ability to apply critical thinking, creative problem solving and the ability to make professional and complex judgements · Experience managing or contributing to long-term fleet planning and lifecycle optimisation is highly desirable If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role via the provided link. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday, 9 November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Luke Hunt, Coordinator Fleet Management Services on 8734 2765. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. item.title: Principal Open Space Planner
item.salary: Band 7 salary from $115,575.61 per annum plus superannuation and a fortnightly RDO Location: Werribee based About the role Join Wyndham’s City Operations Directorate to lead open space policy, including the implementation and update of Wyndham’s Open Space Strategy. You will work alongside a community focused team to develop and implement Open Space policies, strategies and plans, and provide open space planning and urban design advice, to achieve integrated planning and design outcomes which result in consistent, high-quality design and functional open space outcomes across the City. What your day will look like · Provide specialist strategic open space planning and urban design advice on planning permit applications, precinct structure plans, development contribution plans, structure plans, urban design frameworks, master plans, activity centre plans and other planning and development proposals · Develop strategies, policies and plans to guide the planning, development, and management of the City’s open space network · Engage with the Wyndham Community on open space planning issues, requests, and for strategy and policy development · Provide specialist open space planning and urban design advice into projects and initiatives across Council, including externally led projects, to ensure integrated planning and design outcomes are achieved · Prepare reports, submissions, briefing papers, and project update reports for senior management, executive and Council What you will bring · Tertiary qualifications in Open Space Planning, Urban Design, Landscape Architecture, Recreation Planning, Town Planning, Strategic Planning or a related field · Extensive, practical experience in open space planning resulting in a sound knowledge of standards of open space provision within Local Government, particularly in growth areas · A comprehensive knowledge of research, planning methods and urban planning schemes and principles · Extensive, practical experience in policy and report writing · Well-developed communication and collaboration skills · Highly developed analytical, conceptual, dispute resolution and negotiation skills and abilities · Extensive experience in community consultation and working with community groups in the delivery of projects which meet community and Council expectations · Well-developed time management and organisational skills If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and a cover letter which outlines your suitability for the role and responds to the key selection criteria outlined in the position description, via the provided link. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday, 9th November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Bridê Blake, Team Leader Open Space Planning on 03 8734 2640 or email Bride.Blake@wyndham.vic.gov.au Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. Additionally, we are committed to fostering a culture of safety within the Council, which includes the inclusion and empowerment of Aboriginal children, their families, and communities. item.title: Cleansing Litter Garbage & Sanitary
item.salary: Band 2 salary from $73,668.75 per annum plus superannuation and a fortnightly RDO Location: Hoppers Crossing based About the role This role forms part of the Assets and Roads cleansing workforce carrying out allocated tasks to specified standards and schedules in order to meet agreed productivity and quality standards. The successful candidate will be predominantly placed within the Garbage team, however at times will be required to assist in other cleansing teams. The team is looking for an energetic person to assist in keeping Wyndham clean. Ideally, you are someone who enjoys working in growing community to keep Open Space reserves clean and tidy. What your day will look like · Providing a rapid response service as required · Being responsible for the care of plant, tools and equipment, and to fulfill daily allocated tasks. Report any observed road maintenance issues (e.g. potholes, missing pit lids, apply absorbent to spills etc.) · Providing traffic control for other crews as required · Monitoring and reporting items of vehicular maintenance · Performing daily maintenance of vehicle and plant What you will bring · Ability to plan and fulfill daily allocated tasks · A current Victorian Drivers licence including Truck licence (up to 13.9T) · Demonstrated competency in the use of small plant and truck mounted crane · Ability to understand and work to a schedule and plans · Experience in cleansing or other outdoor maintenance works · Demonstrated understanding of OH&S including manual handling and the need to ensure good posture and precautions when working · Sound interpersonal and communication skills both verbal and written If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role via the provided link. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday, 2 November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Darren Roberts, Area Leader Cleansing & Drainage on 8734 2781. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. Child Safe Organisation Wyndham City Council has zero tolerance to any form of child abuse and is committed to the safety, wellbeing and empowerment of children. We create and maintain a child safe organisation which is embedded in the everyday thinking and practice of all employees, volunteers and contractors. Additionally, we are committed to fostering a culture of safety within the Council, which includes the inclusion and empowerment of Aboriginal children, their families, and communities. Our recruitment practices reflect this. Diversity and Inclusion At Wyndham City Council we value workforce diversity and inclusion and embrace individual uniqueness. We value diverse life experiences and the perspectives of our people, while providing high-quality services to all members of our community, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, cultural background, disability, or sexuality. Wyndham has one of the largest Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities in the Western Region, with a rich and diverse history. We are committed to providing positive employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and welcome applications from candidates of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background. To read more about Wyndham City’s Innovate Reconciliation Action Plan, please visit our website . item.title: Customer Service Officer (Talent Pool)
item.salary: Band 4 salary of $78,402.48 per annum plus superannuation and a fortnightly RDO Location: Werribee Based IMPORTANT: This recruitment process is not for an immediate vacancy, but to establish a Talent Pool for future Ongoing or Temporary roles that may arise over the next six months. About the role This role will see you support the Community First Team functions relating to contact centre operations. Phone calls from residents will make up a big part of your day, with the prospect of face-to face interactions once fully trained. You’ll contribute to the great culture in a team of 30 plus agents, servicing the community of Wyndham. To set you up for success, you will be initially working in the office for training and support, with the possibility of a hybrid workweek in the future. What your day will look like · You’ll personally handle or redirect enquiries for over 100+ council services, in an efficient, courteous and professional manner · Provide excellent customer support to the community and staff across all customer channels; phone being the initial starting point · Meet service levels and standards, a focus on customer satisfaction and industry best practice within Council’s policies · Utilise Councils reporting system to record the nature and type of customer enquiries to ensure a successful outcome for the customer What you will bring · Experience in a similar fast-paced customer service role · A natural love of the buzz of a call centre and helping people · A personality that enjoys building relationships with the community · Competence with using a computer and different database programs · A mindset that puts customers at the centre of what you do · A continuous improvement mindset with a positive, proactive, and flexible attitude If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role via the provided link. Applicants may be contacted as opportunities arise if they are considered suitable. Due to the ongoing nature of this recruitment process, communication of an outcome for your application may be delayed. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday 9 November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Jodie Hatfield or Jonothan Woodforde, Team Leaders Customer Service on 1300 023 411. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. item.title: Senior Project Engineer
item.salary: Band 8 salary from $132,607.76 per annum plus superannuation and a fortnightly RDO Location: Werribee based About the role As a Senior Project Engineer within our Roads and Maintenance department, you will take advantage of your sound knowledge of engineering design standards and guidelines, construction principles, project management, contract management and stakeholder engagement to provide specialist technical and engineering support to your unit and other departments. You will effectively manage and coordinate the programming and delivery of major and complex road projects including management of design consultants, subcontractors and stakeholders related to the capital works program and achieve best practice in the provision of infrastructure. As you will be providing direct supervision of the engineering work of unregistered engineers within the unit in accordance with the Professional Engineers Registration Act 2019, you yourself will be required to hold a tertiary qualification in Civil Engineering and a Professional Engineers Registration. What your day will look like · Planning, designing and managing the delivery of major and complex capital works projects across the municipality · Reviewing engineering designs, cost estimates, consultant contracts and tender documentation to ensure quality and compliance · Developing and monitoring project programs, budgets, risk assessments and quality assurance systems to keep projects on track · Work closely with external consultants providing direction, oversight and support to achieve successful outcomes · Coordinating tender assessment panels and ensuring transparent, fair procurement processes · Preparing reports, briefings and presentations for senior management and Council regarding all aspects of the project delivery · Liaising with the public, service authorities, statutory agencies and other stakeholders to communicate project updates and resolve issues collaboratively · Providing guidance, mentoring and technical advice to staff in the planning and delivery of capital works projects What you will bring · Tertiary qualification in Civil Engineering with several years of subsequent relevant experience · Extensive experience in project management of highly complex road projects including budgeting, design, delivery and stakeholder management · Professional Engineers Registration in compliance with the Professional Engineers Registration Act 2019 · Experience in civil road and drainage design, traffic engineering and construction practices · Experience in contract administration and management · Highly developed organisational and project management skills with the ability to work under conflicting pressures and achieve agreed outcomes · Well-developed and demonstrated experience in conflict resolution and problem-solving skills · Knowledge and experience in AutoCAD and 12D for the design of civil road works (desirable) · Previous experience within a Government environment (desirable) If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role via the provided link. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday 9 November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Vince Demaria, Coordinator Engineering Design on 9742 0875. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. Child Safe Organisation Wyndham City Council has zero tolerance to any form of child abuse and is committed to the safety, wellbeing and empowerment of children. We create and maintain a child safe organisation which is embedded in the everyday thinking and practice of all employees, volunteers and contractors. Additionally, we are committed to fostering a culture of safety within the Council, which includes the inclusion and empowerment of Aboriginal children, their families, and communities. Our recruitment practices reflect this. Diversity and Inclusion At Wyndham City Council we value workforce diversity and inclusion and embrace individual uniqueness. We value diverse life experiences and the perspectives of our people, while providing high-quality services to all members of our community, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, cultural background, disability, or sexuality. Wyndham has one of the largest Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities in the Western Region, with a rich and diverse history. item.title: Senior Change Officer
item.salary: Band 7 salary from $115,575.61 per annum plus superannuation and a fortnightly RDO Location: Werribee based About the role Wyndham City’s Facilities, Fleet & Depot Stores Department keeps Council running – maintaining our diverse portfolio of buildings, managing our fleet of vehicles, and ensuring the seamless flow of essential materials, consumables that enable our community outcomes. This exciting opportunity has arisen due to the extended leave of the current officer, offering the chance to contribute to a department undergoing significant transformation and improvement. As our Senior Change Officer, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping the next chapter of this department’s transformation. Working directly with the Manager, Facilities, Fleet & Depot Stores, you’ll design, facilitate, and lead initiatives that strengthen how we work, uplifting capability, improving culture and processes, and embedding sustainable change that supports Council’s strategic direction. This role is for someone who thrives on collaboration, innovation, and seeing ideas come to life. You’ll bring structure to complexity, turn plans into action, and help our people perform at their best as we deliver essential services to the Wyndham community. What your day will look like · Partnering with leaders and teams to co-design initiatives that deliver meaningful and measurable results. · Developing, facilitating, and at times leading implementation of change management strategies for key organisational projects. · Engaging with teams across the department to provide communication, coaching, and on-the-ground support for change adoption. · Conducting impact assessments, identifying stakeholder needs, and supporting readiness for change. · Working with stakeholders to design and deliver training that builds lasting capability. · Supporting project teams to integrate change management into project delivery, ensuring benefits are realised and sustained. · Applying best practice project management and acting as project owner or representative on key initiatives. · Translating strategic direction into practical action, supporting the Department Manager and leadership team to drive outcomes aligned to Council’s values, culture, and priorities. What you will bring · Relevant qualification with several years of subsequent relevant experience OR lesser formal qualifications with extensive relevant experience · PROSCI certification or similar, and project management experience will be advantageous · Experience in communicating to an internal audience using a range of processes and tools · Experience leading large/complex organisational change initiatives will be an advantage · Ability to manage situations with internal stakeholders to resolve specialist problems and build long term relationships · Ability to motivate and facilitate teams and individuals from across the organisation and conduct consultations, take feedback and resolve issues If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role via the provided link. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday, 9 November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Ryan Foote, Manager Facilities Fleet & Depot Stores on 8734 4544. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. item.title: Team Leader Early Education and Care Services (Bachelor Qualified)
item.salary: Salary determined by the EEEA 2020, with in charge allowance Location: Werribee based. This role may be required to work across multiple locations throughout the Wyndham Municipality About the role As Team Leader Education and Care Services, you will be responsible for the day-to-day operations and management of the kindergarten service and a team of educators by providing leadership and pedagogical support and guidance in line with family-centered practice. Reporting to the Area Leader Early Education and Care Services, you will be responsible for overseeing the implementation of planning and developing high quality programs for the service, while creating a team culture operating with a focus on continuous improvement. In addition to this, you will be required to participate in time spent in an educational capacity. You will be the face of the service as you engage with Council’s diverse community on different levels including building relationships with families, staff groups and the community. Engagement will be focussed on ensuring positive family and community participation in line with Council’s integrated service approach. To be eligible for this role you must have the following qualification and registration; Bachelor of Teaching (Early Childhood), Bachelor of Education (Early Childhood) or other relevant approved ACECQA qualification. Valid Victorian Institute of Teaching (VIT) registration What your day will look like Leading and supervising educators and volunteers at Wyndham’s kindergarten service. Proving guidance and support to parents and staff members through a diverse range of complex situations. Management of reporting and financial operation of the service reporting to senior leaders as regularly scheduled. Delivering insights and providing best practice knowledge around current trends in early years education, implementing this in line with the unit goals. Actively contributing to the success of Early Education and Care Services and the Community Life Directorate through teamwork and effective performance of the position responsibilities and duties. What you will bring Mandatory Qualifications to practice as an Early Childhood Teacher (ECT) in Victoria, as outlined in the Position Description: Bachelor of Teaching (Early Childhood), Bachelor of Education (Early Childhood) or other relevant approved ACECQA qualification. Valid Victorian Institute of Teaching (VIT) registration. In addition to the above qualifications: Experience in influence and providing direction to educators at the service, linking your problem solving, mentoring and confident decision-making skills. Extensive experience working in early years education, understanding the range of regulations and policies the service is governed by. Exceptional prioritisation and time management skills, to effectively navigate the duties of this busy role. Strong understanding of the variety of local, state and Commonwealth guidelines and regulations, and the ability to ensure compliance in line with council policies. Valid First Aid Certificate (including CPR) and related certifications as outlined in the position description. If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role via the provided link. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday 9 November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Keith Burnell, Early Years Projects & Operations Lead on 03 8353 4033. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. Child Safe Organisation Wyndham City Council has zero tolerance to any form of child abuse and is committed to the safety, wellbeing and empowerment of children. We create and maintain a child safe organisation which is embedded in the everyday thinking and practice of all employees, volunteers and contractors. Additionally, we are committed to fostering a culture of safety within the Council, which includes the inclusion and empowerment of Aboriginal children, their families, and communities. Our recruitment practices reflect this. Diversity and Inclusion At Wyndham City Council we value workforce diversity and inclusion and embrace individual uniqueness. We value diverse life experiences and the perspectives of our people, while providing high-quality services to all members of our community, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, cultural background, disability, or sexuality. Wyndham has one of the largest Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities in the Western Region, with a rich and diverse history. We are committed to providing positive employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and welcome applications from candidates of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background. To read more about Wyndham City’s Innovate Reconciliation Action Plan, please visit our website . Additional Information Employee Status: Permanent Schedule: Full-time Position Description: PD Current - City Life - Community Support - Team Leader Early Education and Care Services Previous Searches My Profile Create and manage profiles for future opportunities. item.title: Technical Officer
item.salary: Band 5 - Commencing at $81,005 pa Categories: Engineering About the role In this role, you will support Engineers by ensuring that new developments meet Council requirements and standards. In addition, you’ll contribute to creating cutting-edge policies, plans, and practices to enhance our road and drainage infrastructure. This is an exciting opportunity to make a tangible impact on your community while helping to shape its future. Work type: Permanent full time Classification: Band 5 Commencing at $81,005 pa plus super Key responsibilities include: Assist with the evaluation of submitted engineering documentation including drawings and specifications relating to all private subdivisional development to confirm compliance with relevant Council standards and requirements. Assist with overseeing construction of approved subdivisional works in accordance with Council standards including monitoring of safe construction techniques and procedures. Liaise with developers, consultants, contractors, and statutory authorities and provide advice on Council standards and requirements. Liaise and direct activities of Council subdivision inspection personnel. Assist with monitor quality control of construction works. Ensure compliance with planning permit conditions including payment of required monies prior to release of titles for subdivisions. Provide engineering advice on matters such as traffic, drainage, car parking, etc for the issuing of development approvals. About you To be successful in this role, you will have a tertiary qualification in civil engineering, or substantial progress towards or relevant experience in a similar role. You will also have: Demonstrated ability to apply engineering principles in examining engineering documentation for subdivisional plans. Ability to communicate professionally, and concisely with staff and members of the community. Ability to set priorities and plan/organise work allocated. Ability to problem solve and think laterally to come up with innovative solutions to difficult problems. Current Victorian driver’s licence Preferred candidates will be required to undergo a National Police Check as part of the recruitment process (funded by the City). If this sounds like the role for you, then click apply now! Child Safety Responsibilities We are committed to being a child-safe organisation and have zero-tolerance for child abuse. We have specific policies, procedures, and mandatory training in place to support employees, volunteers, and contractors to achieve and adhere to these commitments. Please read our Child Safe Standards Management Policy . Diversity and Inclusion At the City we want a workforce that reflects the community we live in. We welcome and embrace everyone, all people with their own unique experiences, and support and encourage all our employees to do their best work, have equal access to opportunities and a just working environment. For this reason, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from First Nations people, people with diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds, from the LGBTQIA+ community, people with disability and people of all genders, ages and diverse experience. We are the City From parks to offices, childcare centres to works depots, leisure facilities to the Wool Museum and waterfront, our team plays a vital role in shaping our vibrant and growing community. Our community counts on us to get the essentials right while looking for ways to go beyond. By listening, collaborating, and focusing on sustainability, we strive to do the basics brilliantly and create a lasting impact. If you’re ready to be part of something bigger, join us in shaping the future of Geelong. We support accessibility and encourage discussions about any adjustments or support you may need during the recruitment process. Applications and Enquiries Click the Position Description link to view more information about this position. Enquiries: Edwin Rowe

item.title: Expression of Interest – Swim, Sport & Leisure Casual Roles
item.salary: Band 2 Casual LSO - $43.05 p/h (inc casual loading) Categories: Leisure & Recreation We’re seeking enthusiastic, community-focused individuals to join our Swim, Sport & Leisure team. Whether you’re passionate about aquatic safety, teaching swimming, fitness, customer service, or sports coaching, we’d love to hear from you. This Expression of Interest (EOI) allows you to register your details for upcoming recruitment rounds. Submitting an EOI does not guarantee a role will be available ; however, it ensures we have your information on file when opportunities arise. All Swim, Sport & Leisure staff must hold a valid employee Working with Children Check (WWCC). Roles We Recruit For Lifeguard (Additional summer recruitment starts September) Ensure the safety and enjoyment of aquatic patrons Maintain high standards of pool supervision and safety compliance Essential: WWCC, CPR, First Aid, Lifeguard Qualification Learn to Swim Teacher Teach and assess swimming programs for all ages Engage positively with students and families Essential: WWCC, CPR, Swim Teacher License Customer Service Be the welcoming face of our centres Assist with memberships, bookings, and enquiries Essential: WWCC, CPR Gym Instructor Provide safe, effective gym instruction Screen, assess, and create personalised programs Deliver gym floor sessions Essential: WWCC, CPR, First Aid, Cert III (or higher) in Fitness Coaching / Referee Coach or officiate sports programs in a safe, inclusive environment Build participation and enjoyment for all skill levels Essential: WWCC, CPR, First Aid, Relevant Coaching Accreditation Locations Roles may be available at Bellarine Aquatic & Sports Centre, Norlane ARC, Leisurelink, Splashdown, Kardinia Aquatic Centre, Lara Aquatic Centre, North Bellarine Aquatic Centre, and Leisuretime Sports Precinct. If you’re passionate about recreation, safety, and community wellbeing, we’d love to receive your EOI. Please have your qualifications ready to upload. Child Safety We are a child-safe organisation with zero tolerance for child abuse. Policies, procedures, and training support all staff to uphold these commitments. Please review our Child Safe Standards Management Policy . Diversity & Inclusion We aim for a workforce that reflects our community and values diverse experiences. We ensure equal opportunity and encourage applications from First Nations peoples, culturally diverse communities, LGBTQIA+ individuals, people with disabilities, and people of all genders, ages, and experiences. About Us – We Are the City From parks to offices, leisure centres to waterfront attractions, our team shapes Geelong’s vibrant community. We deliver essentials brilliantly while striving for sustainability, collaboration, and long-term impact. We support accessibility and welcome discussions about adjustments during recruitment. Applications & Enquiries Position Description (Word) Position Description (PDF) Applications close: 11:55 pm, 1 August 2026 Enquiries: Talent Team

item.salary: Band 2 - Commencing at $66,631 pa Categories: Aged & Disability Support About the role As a part-time Community Care Worker, you will provide assistance to our Home Care Clients to maintain and improve their life, by providing of a range of direct practical assistance in their homes. Work type: Permanent Part-Time (15 - 25hrs per week) Classification: Band 2 $33.72 per hour + super Key responsibilities include: Perform general housework and cleaning Meal preparation Personal care tasks including personal grooming Provide support in maintaining social contacts, emotional health and well-being Monitor clients’ health and well-being and report any concerns. About you To be successful in this role, you will have experience providing personal care, domestic and household activities to people who are ageing, live with disability or mental illness. You will also: Hold a Certificate III in Individual Support (Aged) or equivalent Have a current First Aid Level 2, including CPR module Be willing to undergo a national police check, medical and functional assessments Have a current driver’s license, comprehensive insurance and a reliable registered motor vehicle Be physically able to carry out a range of household duties Have availability of 3 weekdays or greater Preferred candidates will be required to undergo a National Police Check and a Pre Employment Medical Assessment as part of the recruitment process.
