item.title: Area Leader Capital Delivery
item.salary: Band 8 salary from $132,607.76 per annum plus superannuation and a fortnightly RDO Location: Werribee based About the role We have two key opportunities, reporting to the Coordinator Construction and Development Services, for an Area Leader (Brownfields) and Area Leader (Greenfields). These roles are responsible for leading the operational delivery of Council’s capital works program, with a strong emphasis on building projects across both established (Brownfields) and growth (Greenfields) areas. Each Area Leader will provide strategic and day-to-day leadership, coordination, and professional support to a team of Senior Project Managers and Project Managers, ensuring the successful planning, design, procurement, and delivery of high-quality community infrastructure. You will ensure infrastructure and facilities projects are delivered on time, on budget, and to the highest quality and compliance standards while fostering a high-performance, collaborative team culture. This role also supports resource management, program-level oversight, risk management, financial accountability, and long-term infrastructure investment planning. Working within the Construction and Development Services Unit in the Facilities, Fleet & Depot Stores Department of the City Operations Directorate, you will be instrumental in driving continuous improvement in project management capability, stakeholder engagement, and service delivery for the community. This position may require occasional weekend, public holiday, and after-hours work, as well as travel across the municipality. What your day will look like · Lead, mentor, and supervise Senior Project Managers and Project Managers to ensure effective delivery of capital works projects · Oversee operational leadership across capital works programs, including project milestones, resource planning, and reporting · Ensure compliance with codes, scope, budget, time, and quality standards, escalating issues where necessary · Manage financial activities including budget preparation, forecasting, and cost control · Oversee preparation and quality control of project documentation from design to delivery including contracts, tenders, and contractor performance reports · Promote strong stakeholder engagement and communication to minimise disruptions and maximise community benefit · Drive continuous improvement in project management systems, processes, and governance What you will bring · Tertiary qualification in Project Management, Civil/Structural Engineering, Construction Management, Architecture, or a related discipline · Extensive experience delivering complex infrastructure projects, with a focus on facilities greenfield or brownfield delivery, in a public sector, consulting, or construction environment · Proven leadership skills in managing and developing multidisciplinary project teams · Strong financial, contract administration, risk management, and WHS compliance knowledge · High-level proficiency in project management systems · Excellent stakeholder engagement, negotiation, and communication skills · Understanding of long-term asset planning and infrastructure investment strategies · Current Victorian Driver’s Licence, Construction Induction (White) Card, and Working with Children Check If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role via the provided link. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday, 9 November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Amol Khapre, Coordinator Construction & Development Services on 9394 6881. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. Child Safe Organisation Wyndham City Council has zero tolerance to any form of child abuse and is committed to the safety, wellbeing and empowerment of children. We create and maintain a child safe organisation which is embedded in the everyday thinking and practice of all employees, volunteers and contractors. Additionally, we are committed to fostering a culture of safety within the Council, which includes the inclusion and empowerment of Aboriginal children, their families, and communities. Our recruitment practices reflect this. Diversity and Inclusion At Wyndham City Council we value workforce diversity and inclusion and embrace individual uniqueness. We value diverse life experiences and the perspectives of our people, while providing high-quality services to all members of our community, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, cultural background, disability, or sexuality. Wyndham has one of the largest Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities in the Western Region, with a rich and diverse history. We are committed to providing positive employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and welcome applications from candidates of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background. To read more about Wyndham City’s Innovate Reconciliation Action Plan, please visit our website . item.title: Senior Fleet Officer
item.salary: Band 6 salary from $104,133.36 per annum plus superannuation and a fortnightly RDO Location: Werribee and Hoppers Crossing based About the role As a Senior Fleet Officer, you will partner with Team Leader Fleet Management to deliver a fully integrated approach to fleet procurement, lifecycle maintenance, and policy compliance. You will make this role your own driving the specialist data, systems, and procurement functions that keep Council’s fleet safe, cost-efficient, and compliant to audits while looking for improvements along the way. What your day will look like · Managing the yearly Fleet Procurement Plan, including light vehicles, trucks, specialised fleet items and plant, using proven assessment methods of assets due for changeover and make recommendations on appropriate replacements · Developing vehicle and plant specifications with relevant stakeholders ensuring alignment with operational needs and Council policy · Leading the procurement process including preparation of Tender and RFQ documentation · Maintaining the accuracy of Fleet data in Council’s long-term financial place and asset plan, and assets plan · Administering the roadside assistance programs, fuel cards, registration renewal and toll invoice processing · Administering Council’s GPS platform, including data accuracy user access and vendor liaison · Overseeing the pool-vehicle booking system, ensuring availability, utilisation reporting and user support · Analysing fleet lifecycle cost, utilisation, and data, and support implementation of data-informed approaches to optimise Fleet What you will bring · Degree or diploma in a relevant field with relevant experience OR a lesser qualification with substantial relevant experience in procurement · Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills both verbal and written, with the ability to deal with a diverse range of stakeholders · Well-developed time management and organisational skills with the ability to work autonomously · Demonstrated ability to apply critical thinking, creative problem solving and the ability to make professional and complex judgements · Experience managing or contributing to long-term fleet planning and lifecycle optimisation is highly desirable If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role via the provided link. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday, 9 November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Luke Hunt, Coordinator Fleet Management Services on 8734 2765. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. item.title: Principal Open Space Planner
item.salary: Band 7 salary from $115,575.61 per annum plus superannuation and a fortnightly RDO Location: Werribee based About the role Join Wyndham’s City Operations Directorate to lead open space policy, including the implementation and update of Wyndham’s Open Space Strategy. You will work alongside a community focused team to develop and implement Open Space policies, strategies and plans, and provide open space planning and urban design advice, to achieve integrated planning and design outcomes which result in consistent, high-quality design and functional open space outcomes across the City. What your day will look like · Provide specialist strategic open space planning and urban design advice on planning permit applications, precinct structure plans, development contribution plans, structure plans, urban design frameworks, master plans, activity centre plans and other planning and development proposals · Develop strategies, policies and plans to guide the planning, development, and management of the City’s open space network · Engage with the Wyndham Community on open space planning issues, requests, and for strategy and policy development · Provide specialist open space planning and urban design advice into projects and initiatives across Council, including externally led projects, to ensure integrated planning and design outcomes are achieved · Prepare reports, submissions, briefing papers, and project update reports for senior management, executive and Council What you will bring · Tertiary qualifications in Open Space Planning, Urban Design, Landscape Architecture, Recreation Planning, Town Planning, Strategic Planning or a related field · Extensive, practical experience in open space planning resulting in a sound knowledge of standards of open space provision within Local Government, particularly in growth areas · A comprehensive knowledge of research, planning methods and urban planning schemes and principles · Extensive, practical experience in policy and report writing · Well-developed communication and collaboration skills · Highly developed analytical, conceptual, dispute resolution and negotiation skills and abilities · Extensive experience in community consultation and working with community groups in the delivery of projects which meet community and Council expectations · Well-developed time management and organisational skills If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and a cover letter which outlines your suitability for the role and responds to the key selection criteria outlined in the position description, via the provided link. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday, 9th November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Bridê Blake, Team Leader Open Space Planning on 03 8734 2640 or email Bride.Blake@wyndham.vic.gov.au Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. Child Safe Organisation Wyndham City Council has zero tolerance to any form of child abuse and is committed to the safety, wellbeing and empowerment of children. We create and maintain a child safe organisation which is embedded in the everyday thinking and practice of all employees, volunteers and contractors. Additionally, we are committed to fostering a culture of safety within the Council, which includes the inclusion and empowerment of Aboriginal children, their families, and communities. Our recruitment practices reflect this. Diversity and Inclusion At Wyndham City Council we value workforce diversity and inclusion and embrace individual uniqueness. We value diverse life experiences and the perspectives of our people, while providing high-quality services to all members of our community, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, cultural background, disability, or sexuality. Wyndham has one of the largest Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities in the Western Region, with a rich and diverse history. We are committed to providing positive employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and welcome applications from candidates of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background. To read more about Wyndham City’s Innovate Reconciliation Action Plan, please visit our website . item.title: Cleansing Litter Garbage & Sanitary
item.salary: Band 2 salary from $73,668.75 per annum plus superannuation and a fortnightly RDO Location: Hoppers Crossing based About the role This role forms part of the Assets and Roads cleansing workforce carrying out allocated tasks to specified standards and schedules in order to meet agreed productivity and quality standards. The successful candidate will be predominantly placed within the Garbage team, however at times will be required to assist in other cleansing teams. The team is looking for an energetic person to assist in keeping Wyndham clean. Ideally, you are someone who enjoys working in growing community to keep Open Space reserves clean and tidy. What your day will look like · Providing a rapid response service as required · Being responsible for the care of plant, tools and equipment, and to fulfill daily allocated tasks. Report any observed road maintenance issues (e.g. potholes, missing pit lids, apply absorbent to spills etc.) · Providing traffic control for other crews as required · Monitoring and reporting items of vehicular maintenance · Performing daily maintenance of vehicle and plant What you will bring · Ability to plan and fulfill daily allocated tasks · A current Victorian Drivers licence including Truck licence (up to 13.9T) · Demonstrated competency in the use of small plant and truck mounted crane · Ability to understand and work to a schedule and plans · Experience in cleansing or other outdoor maintenance works · Demonstrated understanding of OH&S including manual handling and the need to ensure good posture and precautions when working · Sound interpersonal and communication skills both verbal and written If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Darren Roberts, Area Leader Cleansing & Drainage on 8734 2781. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. item.title: Customer Service Officer (Talent Pool)
item.salary: Band 4 salary of $78,402.48 per annum plus superannuation and a fortnightly RDO Location: Werribee Based IMPORTANT: This recruitment process is not for an immediate vacancy, but to establish a Talent Pool for future Ongoing or Temporary roles that may arise over the next six months. About the role This role will see you support the Community First Team functions relating to contact centre operations. Phone calls from residents will make up a big part of your day, with the prospect of face-to face interactions once fully trained. You’ll contribute to the great culture in a team of 30 plus agents, servicing the community of Wyndham. To set you up for success, you will be initially working in the office for training and support, with the possibility of a hybrid workweek in the future. What your day will look like · You’ll personally handle or redirect enquiries for over 100+ council services, in an efficient, courteous and professional manner · Provide excellent customer support to the community and staff across all customer channels; phone being the initial starting point · Meet service levels and standards, a focus on customer satisfaction and industry best practice within Council’s policies · Utilise Councils reporting system to record the nature and type of customer enquiries to ensure a successful outcome for the customer What you will bring · Experience in a similar fast-paced customer service role · A natural love of the buzz of a call centre and helping people · A personality that enjoys building relationships with the community · Competence with using a computer and different database programs · A mindset that puts customers at the centre of what you do · A continuous improvement mindset with a positive, proactive, and flexible attitude If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role via the provided link. Applicants may be contacted as opportunities arise if they are considered suitable. Due to the ongoing nature of this recruitment process, communication of an outcome for your application may be delayed. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday 9 November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Jodie Hatfield or Jonothan Woodforde, Team Leaders Customer Service on 1300 023 411. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. item.title: Senior Project Engineer
item.salary: Band 8 salary from $132,607.76 per annum plus superannuation and a fortnightly RDO Location: Werribee based About the role As a Senior Project Engineer within our Roads and Maintenance department, you will take advantage of your sound knowledge of engineering design standards and guidelines, construction principles, project management, contract management and stakeholder engagement to provide specialist technical and engineering support to your unit and other departments. You will effectively manage and coordinate the programming and delivery of major and complex road projects including management of design consultants, subcontractors and stakeholders related to the capital works program and achieve best practice in the provision of infrastructure. As you will be providing direct supervision of the engineering work of unregistered engineers within the unit in accordance with the Professional Engineers Registration Act 2019, you yourself will be required to hold a tertiary qualification in Civil Engineering and a Professional Engineers Registration. What your day will look like · Planning, designing and managing the delivery of major and complex capital works projects across the municipality · Reviewing engineering designs, cost estimates, consultant contracts and tender documentation to ensure quality and compliance · Developing and monitoring project programs, budgets, risk assessments and quality assurance systems to keep projects on track · Work closely with external consultants providing direction, oversight and support to achieve successful outcomes · Coordinating tender assessment panels and ensuring transparent, fair procurement processes · Preparing reports, briefings and presentations for senior management and Council regarding all aspects of the project delivery · Liaising with the public, service authorities, statutory agencies and other stakeholders to communicate project updates and resolve issues collaboratively · Providing guidance, mentoring and technical advice to staff in the planning and delivery of capital works projects What you will bring · Tertiary qualification in Civil Engineering with several years of subsequent relevant experience · Extensive experience in project management of highly complex road projects including budgeting, design, delivery and stakeholder management · Professional Engineers Registration in compliance with the Professional Engineers Registration Act 2019 · Experience in civil road and drainage design, traffic engineering and construction practices · Experience in contract administration and management · Highly developed organisational and project management skills with the ability to work under conflicting pressures and achieve agreed outcomes · Well-developed and demonstrated experience in conflict resolution and problem-solving skills · Knowledge and experience in AutoCAD and 12D for the design of civil road works (desirable) · Previous experience within a Government environment (desirable) If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role via the provided link. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday 9 November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Vince Demaria, Coordinator Engineering Design on 9742 0875. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. item.title: Senior Change Officer
item.salary: Band 7 salary from $115,575.61 per annum plus superannuation and a fortnightly RDO Location: Werribee based About the role Wyndham City’s Facilities, Fleet & Depot Stores Department keeps Council running – maintaining our diverse portfolio of buildings, managing our fleet of vehicles, and ensuring the seamless flow of essential materials, consumables that enable our community outcomes. This exciting opportunity has arisen due to the extended leave of the current officer, offering the chance to contribute to a department undergoing significant transformation and improvement. As our Senior Change Officer, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping the next chapter of this department’s transformation. Working directly with the Manager, Facilities, Fleet & Depot Stores, you’ll design, facilitate, and lead initiatives that strengthen how we work, uplifting capability, improving culture and processes, and embedding sustainable change that supports Council’s strategic direction. This role is for someone who thrives on collaboration, innovation, and seeing ideas come to life. You’ll bring structure to complexity, turn plans into action, and help our people perform at their best as we deliver essential services to the Wyndham community. What your day will look like · Partnering with leaders and teams to co-design initiatives that deliver meaningful and measurable results. · Developing, facilitating, and at times leading implementation of change management strategies for key organisational projects. · Engaging with teams across the department to provide communication, coaching, and on-the-ground support for change adoption. · Conducting impact assessments, identifying stakeholder needs, and supporting readiness for change. · Working with stakeholders to design and deliver training that builds lasting capability. · Supporting project teams to integrate change management into project delivery, ensuring benefits are realised and sustained. · Applying best practice project management and acting as project owner or representative on key initiatives. · Translating strategic direction into practical action, supporting the Department Manager and leadership team to drive outcomes aligned to Council’s values, culture, and priorities. What you will bring · Relevant qualification with several years of subsequent relevant experience OR lesser formal qualifications with extensive relevant experience · PROSCI certification or similar, and project management experience will be advantageous · Experience in communicating to an internal audience using a range of processes and tools · Experience leading large/complex organisational change initiatives will be an advantage · Ability to manage situations with internal stakeholders to resolve specialist problems and build long term relationships · Ability to motivate and facilitate teams and individuals from across the organisation and conduct consultations, take feedback and resolve issues If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role via the provided link. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday, 9 November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Ryan Foote, Manager Facilities Fleet & Depot Stores on 8734 4544. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. Child Safe Organisation Wyndham City Council has zero tolerance to any form of child abuse and is committed to the safety, wellbeing and empowerment of children. We create and maintain a child safe organisation which is embedded in the everyday thinking and practice of all employees, volunteers and contractors. Additionally, we are committed to fostering a culture of safety within the Council, which includes the inclusion and empowerment of Aboriginal children, their families, and communities. Our recruitment practices reflect this. Diversity and Inclusion At Wyndham City Council we value workforce diversity and inclusion and embrace individual uniqueness. We value diverse life experiences and the perspectives of our people, while providing high-quality services to all members of our community, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, cultural background, disability, or sexuality. Wyndham has one of the largest Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities in the Western Region, with a rich and diverse history. We are committed to providing positive employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and welcome applications from candidates of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background. To read more about Wyndham City’s Innovate Reconciliation Action Plan, please visit our website . item.title: Team Leader Early Education and Care Services (Bachelor Qualified)
item.salary: Salary determined by the EEEA 2020, with in charge allowance Location: Werribee based. This role may be required to work across multiple locations throughout the Wyndham Municipality About the role As Team Leader Education and Care Services, you will be responsible for the day-to-day operations and management of the kindergarten service and a team of educators by providing leadership and pedagogical support and guidance in line with family-centered practice. Reporting to the Area Leader Early Education and Care Services, you will be responsible for overseeing the implementation of planning and developing high quality programs for the service, while creating a team culture operating with a focus on continuous improvement. In addition to this, you will be required to participate in time spent in an educational capacity. You will be the face of the service as you engage with Council’s diverse community on different levels including building relationships with families, staff groups and the community. Engagement will be focussed on ensuring positive family and community participation in line with Council’s integrated service approach. To be eligible for this role you must have the following qualification and registration; Bachelor of Teaching (Early Childhood), Bachelor of Education (Early Childhood) or other relevant approved ACECQA qualification. Valid Victorian Institute of Teaching (VIT) registration What your day will look like Leading and supervising educators and volunteers at Wyndham’s kindergarten service. Proving guidance and support to parents and staff members through a diverse range of complex situations. Management of reporting and financial operation of the service reporting to senior leaders as regularly scheduled. Delivering insights and providing best practice knowledge around current trends in early years education, implementing this in line with the unit goals. Actively contributing to the success of Early Education and Care Services and the Community Life Directorate through teamwork and effective performance of the position responsibilities and duties. What you will bring Mandatory Qualifications to practice as an Early Childhood Teacher (ECT) in Victoria, as outlined in the Position Description: Bachelor of Teaching (Early Childhood), Bachelor of Education (Early Childhood) or other relevant approved ACECQA qualification. Valid Victorian Institute of Teaching (VIT) registration. In addition to the above qualifications: Experience in influence and providing direction to educators at the service, linking your problem solving, mentoring and confident decision-making skills. Extensive experience working in early years education, understanding the range of regulations and policies the service is governed by. Exceptional prioritisation and time management skills, to effectively navigate the duties of this busy role. Strong understanding of the variety of local, state and Commonwealth guidelines and regulations, and the ability to ensure compliance in line with council policies. Valid First Aid Certificate (including CPR) and related certifications as outlined in the position description. If you progress past the interview stage, you may be required to complete pre-employment screening, which may include police checks, a medical, qualification verification, and an Australian work rights check. Why join Wyndham We are one of Australia’s fastest growing and most diverse cities. By 2040, we will have more than 500,000 residents and our people are hard at work designing the precincts, building the infrastructure, developing the policies and delivering the programs that will ensure the City is prepared. Look at our job opportunities and you may be surprised at what you discover: a future-focused culture, a sense of purpose and possibility, and real opportunities to strengthen our diverse community. It all adds up to make Wyndham City a great place to belong. Our people are our most valued asset. We are focused on building a culture that empowers every person to do their best work. Flexibility is built right into our DNA and we are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace that celebrates a diverse workforce. How to apply Please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the role via the provided link. Applications close at 11:59PM on Sunday 9 November 2025. If you have further role-specific questions, please contact Keith Burnell, Early Years Projects & Operations Lead on 03 8353 4033. Wyndham City Council is committed to providing a recruitment experience that is fair, inclusive, and accessible. If you have specific accessibility needs or general recruitment enquiries, please contact our Careers team via careers@wyndham.vic.gov.au or 03 9394 6860. Child Safe Organisation Wyndham City Council has zero tolerance to any form of child abuse and is committed to the safety, wellbeing and empowerment of children. We create and maintain a child safe organisation which is embedded in the everyday thinking and practice of all employees, volunteers and contractors. Additionally, we are committed to fostering a culture of safety within the Council, which includes the inclusion and empowerment of Aboriginal children, their families, and communities. Our recruitment practices reflect this. Diversity and Inclusion At Wyndham City Council we value workforce diversity and inclusion and embrace individual uniqueness. We value diverse life experiences and the perspectives of our people, while providing high-quality services to all members of our community, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, cultural background, disability, or sexuality. Wyndham has one of the largest Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities in the Western Region, with a rich and diverse history. We are committed to providing positive employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and welcome applications from candidates of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background. To read more about Wyndham City’s Innovate Reconciliation Action Plan, please visit our website . item.title: Technical Officer
item.salary: Band 5 - Commencing at $81,005 pa Categories: Engineering About the role In this role, you will support Engineers by ensuring that new developments meet Council requirements and standards. In addition, you’ll contribute to creating cutting-edge policies, plans, and practices to enhance our road and drainage infrastructure. This is an exciting opportunity to make a tangible impact on your community while helping to shape its future. Work type: Permanent full time Classification: Band 5 Commencing at $81,005 pa plus super Key responsibilities include: Assist with the evaluation of submitted engineering documentation including drawings and specifications relating to all private subdivisional development to confirm compliance with relevant Council standards and requirements. Assist with overseeing construction of approved subdivisional works in accordance with Council standards including monitoring of safe construction techniques and procedures. Liaise with developers, consultants, contractors, and statutory authorities and provide advice on Council standards and requirements. Liaise and direct activities of Council subdivision inspection personnel. Assist with monitor quality control of construction works. Ensure compliance with planning permit conditions including payment of required monies prior to release of titles for subdivisions. Provide engineering advice on matters such as traffic, drainage, car parking, etc for the issuing of development approvals. About you To be successful in this role, you will have a tertiary qualification in civil engineering, or substantial progress towards or relevant experience in a similar role. You will also have: Demonstrated ability to apply engineering principles in examining engineering documentation for subdivisional plans. Ability to communicate professionally, and concisely with staff and members of the community. Ability to set priorities and plan/organise work allocated. Ability to problem solve and think laterally to come up with innovative solutions to difficult problems. Current Victorian driver’s licence Preferred candidates will be required to undergo a National Police Check as part of the recruitment process (funded by the City). If this sounds like the role for you, then click apply now! Child Safety Responsibilities We are committed to being a child-safe organisation and have zero-tolerance for child abuse. We have specific policies, procedures, and mandatory training in place to support employees, volunteers, and contractors to achieve and adhere to these commitments. Please read our Child Safe Standards Management Policy . Diversity and Inclusion At the City we want a workforce that reflects the community we live in. We welcome and embrace everyone, all people with their own unique experiences, and support and encourage all our employees to do their best work, have equal access to opportunities and a just working environment. For this reason, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from First Nations people, people with diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds, from the LGBTQIA+ community, people with disability and people of all genders, ages and diverse experience. We are the City From parks to offices, childcare centres to works depots, leisure facilities to the Wool Museum and waterfront, our team plays a vital role in shaping our vibrant and growing community. Our community counts on us to get the essentials right while looking for ways to go beyond. By listening, collaborating, and focusing on sustainability, we strive to do the basics brilliantly and create a lasting impact. If you’re ready to be part of something bigger, join us in shaping the future of Geelong. We support accessibility and encourage discussions about any adjustments or support you may need during the recruitment process. Applications and Enquiries Click the Position Description link to view more information about this position. Enquiries: Edwin Rowe
